borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><br></p><p><span style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The development fails to provide&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">safe</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;and secure cycle parking spaces that comply with the London Cycling Design Standards. As such, the development is contrary to:</span></span></p><ul><li style="margin-bottom: 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Policy T5 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Policy BR9 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011); and</span></span></li><li style="margin-bottom: 7.5pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Policy DMT 3 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (December 2021).</span></span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">The development fails to provide the required number of waste and recycling bins, that would be positioned in a convenient and appropriate location within the site. As such, the development is contrary to:</span></span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Policy BR15 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011); and</span></span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">LBBD Planning Advice Note on Waste and Recycling Provisions in New and Refurbished Residential Developments (20 May 2021).</span></span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed HMO has the potential to increase activity level and coming and goings to and from the site leading to additional levels of noise and disturbance at the property. This is considered to have a negative impact on neighbouring amenity and in turn the health and wellbeing of neighbouring residents. As such the proposal is contrary to the following:</span></p><ul><li style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies DMD 1, SP 7 and DMSI 3 of the Draft Local Plan; and</span></li><li style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;"><span arial="">Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)</span></span>.</span></li></ul>

<p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed development&nbsp;results in a loss of a family-sized unit which is a priority house type within the Borough, it would introduce an HMO&nbsp;in an area of low transport accessibility, and it was not demonstrated that there is a&nbsp;need for an HMO.&nbsp;As such, the proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to the following:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy BC4 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011); and</span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies SP 3 and DMH 5 of the&nbsp;Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (December 2021).</span></li></ul>
description: Retrospective application for the conversion of the dwelling (C3) into a 6x bedroom HMO (C4)

constraints_details.result: 87 Clemence Road, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM10 9YQ
